title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development designates military installations selected for closure or realignment as enterprise zones under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. These zones include the local community where the installation is located. Additionally, the Secretary designates certain areas as redevelopment areas under the Public Works Act. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations selected for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas under the Public Works Act, including the local community within its jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas within the local community's jurisdiction, to be done within 60 days of recommendation in a base closure report. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas within 60 days of recommendation in a base closure report. The President reports to Congress on base closures and realignments, which must be approved within 60 days. Designated enterprise zones are additional to the 100 already established. The Act requires base closures or realignments to be approved within 60 days. Designated enterprise zones are additional to the 100 already established. The enterprise zones designated under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 may receive funding for economic adjustment assistance from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or the Secretary of Commerce. The enterprise zone designated under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 may receive funding for economic adjustment assistance from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or the Secretary of Commerce. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area shall remain in effect for a 5-year period, with an annual review conducted by the Secretary of Commerce thereafter. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area shall remain in effect for a 5-year period, with an annual review conducted by the Secretary of Commerce thereafter. The Secretary will terminate or modify the designation if the area no longer meets the requirements. The term "base closure law" refers to the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area will be reviewed annually by the Secretary of Commerce for a 5-year period. The Secretary can terminate or modify the designation if it no longer meets the requirements. The term "base closure law" refers to specific legislative acts. Substantial realignment refers to a significant reduction in military installation operations. The term "substantial realignment" refers to a significant reduction in military installation operations where 50 percent or more of personnel are reassigned to another military installation. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certain certifications are made to Congress. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until specific certifications are provided to Congress regarding their potential commercial or redevelopment uses.
